metadata.Title: CVE-2020-10745 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in all Samba versions before 4.10.17, before 4.11.11 andbefore 4.12.4 in the way it processed NetBios over TCP/IP. This flaw allowsa remote attacker could to cause the Samba server to consume excessive CPUuse, resulting in a denial of service. This highest threat from thisvulnerability is to system availability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-10745` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ctdb - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.3
libnss-winbind - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.3
libpam-winbind - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.3
libsmbclient - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.3
libwbclient0 - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.3
python3-samba - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.3
registry-tools - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.3
samba - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.3
samba-common - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.3
samba-common-bin - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.3
samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.3
samba-libs - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.3
samba-testsuite - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.3
samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.3
smbclient - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.3
winbind - 2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: samba package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:4.11.6+dfsg-0ubuntu1.3').
